intro: Gnaphaliothamnus cryptocephalus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
